subject: RE: [junit] HTML/XHTML Validation w/JUnit
msgSnippet: ... Well, it s basically a convenient wrapper for XMLUnit, coming with pre-packaged DTD s and such... ... I think so... :) I was quite shocked that IE doesn t
messageBody:
J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
> Ilja Preuss wrote:
>
>> J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>>
>> > There's probably no project that has extracted this for reuse,
>> because > there's almost nothing to it.
>>
>> Actually Johannes Link is working on XHTMLUnit which does this (and
>> more, of course). Hopefully it will appear on Source Forge soon.
>
> Interesting. I wonder what it does that XMLUnit and HtmlUnit don't do.

Well, it's basically a convenient wrapper for XMLUnit, coming with
pre-packaged DTD's and such...

>> I am also working on including basic tests for HTML 4 compatibility.
>
> Neat.

I think so... :)

I was quite shocked that IE doesn't even understand

<html>
<head>
<title />
</head>
<body>
hello
</body>
</html>

Regards, Ilja
